description: For approximately 30 years, Joseph Cornell worked in relative obscurity in the basement of his home in Queens, New York, creating wondrous miniature worlds within his boxed constructions. In Untitled (Hôtel de la Duchess-Anne), Cornell combined a bird-shaped piece of wood, postage stamps, a metal spring, bingo chips, a bouncy ball, and newspaper clippings, evoking ideas of childhood and travel.
title: Untitled (Hôtel de la Duchesse-Anne)
